pullRequest.title: Don't issue warnings about compiler-inserted modifiers; fixes #3305

commit.message: Don't issue warnings about (more) compiler-inserted modifiers; fixes #3305

nodes.bodyText: Do you want to add a test with an expected error, e.g. for try (@Nullable final AutoCloseable obj = null) {?

I'm always a bit worried about using Paths, because they can be costly.
I think you can simplify this significantly:

determine the variable kind once kind = TreeUtils.elementFromDeclaration((VariableTree) node).getKind()
if kind is ENUM_CONSTANT it's an enum constant
if kind is RESOURCE_VARIABLE it's a try resource

So you don't need a path and the two checks are more symmetric.

commit.message: Fix comments that were not updated when an argument was removed
Use more efficient and uniform test
Merge branch 'trywithresources-annobeforemodifier' of github.com:mernst/checker-framework into trywithresources-annobeforemodifier
